traits.name: Ability Score Increase
traits.description: Your Strength score increases by 2, and your Wisdom score increases by 1.

traits.name: Age
traits.description: Young tortles crawl for a few weeks after birth before learning to walk on two legs. They reach adulthood by the afe of 15 and live an average of 50 years.

traits.name: Alignment
traits.description: Tortles tend to lead orderly, ritualistic lives. They develop customs and routines, becoming more set in their ways as they age. Most are lawful good. A few can be selfish and greedy, tending more toward evil, but it's unusual for a tortle to shuck off order in favor of chaos.

traits.name: Size
traits.description: Tortle adults stand 5 to 60 feet tall and average 450 pounds. Their shells account for roughly one-third of their weight. Your size is Medium.

traits.name: Speed
traits.description: Your base walking speed is 30 feet.

traits.name: Claws
traits.description: Your claws are natural weapons, which you can use to make unarmed strikes. If you hit with them, you deal slashing damage equal to 1d4 + your Strength modifier, instead of bludgeoning damage normal for an unarmed strike.

traits.name: Hold Breath
traits.description: You can hold your breath for up to 1 hour at a time. Tortles aren't natural swimmers, but they can remain underwater for some time before needing to come up for air.

traits.name: Natural Armor
traits.description: Due to your shell and the shape of your body, you are ill-suited to wearing armor. Your shell provides ample protection, however; it gives you a base AC of 17 (your Dexterity modifier doesn't affect this number). You gain no benefit from wearing armor, but if you are using a shield, you can apply the shield's bonus as normal.

traits.name: Shell Defense
traits.description: You can withdraw into your shell as an action. Until you emerge, you gain a +4 bonus to AC, and you have advantage on Strength and Constitution saving throws. While in your shell, you are prone, your speed is 0 and can't increase, you have disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws, you can't take reactions, and the only action you can take is a bonus action to emerge from your shell.

traits.name: Survival Instinct
traits.description: You gain proficiency in the Survival skill. Tortles have finely honed survival instincts.

traits.name: Languages
traits.description: You can speak, read, and write Aquan and Common.
